document_data.mainbody: '''Singye''' was a city in the kingdom of [[Koryo]] in [[Kara-Tur]].
document_data.Geography:
Singye lay at the edge of the great [[Quang Muku Forest]], by the sea.

[[E'Tyon Bay]] lay just north of Singye.
document_data.History:
By [[1357 DR]], E'Tyon Bay had become infested by [[tigerworm]]s, which sunk four fishing boats and a merchant ship. Singye authorities offered a reward to any who could eliminate the menace.

In that year, following battles between Koryoan troops and advance forces of [[Kozakura]] around [[Karak]] in the south, around a thousand refugees fled to Singye and camped outside the city.
document_data.Inhabitants: Singye was home to the [[wu jen]] [[Yuraka]], owner of the last known scroll case of the ''[[Ky Trencha Ukang]]''.
